context: <a0_0>As a child<a0_0/>, Spielberg faced difficulty reconciling being an Orthodox Jew with the perception of him by other children he played with. "It isn't something I enjoy admitting," he once said, "but when I was <a4_0>seven, eight, <b9_0>nine years old<b9_0/><a4_0/>, God forgive me, I was <a1_0>embarrassed<a1_0/> because we were Orthodox Jews. I was embarrassed by the outward perception of my parents' Jewish practices. I was never really ashamed to be Jewish, but I was uneasy at times." Spielberg also said he suffered from acts of <a2_0><a5_0><b11_0>anti-Semitic<b11_0/><a2_0/> prejudice<a5_0/> and bullying: "In high school, I got smacked and kicked around. <a3_0><a6_0><b7_0><b8_0><b10_0>Two<b10_0/><b8_0/><b7_0/><a6_0/><a3_0/> bloody noses. It was horrible."
